title: Introduction to Chinese Scripts
description: An elementary course to introduce basic Chinese characters with real life examples. Introduction will also be given to the formation of Chinese characters, stroke order, and the interesting stories behind some Chinese.

title: Application of Vocabulary and Grammar I
description: An elementary course designed to familiarize students with the use of Romanization, basic vocabulary and grammar points. Vocabulary introduced based on everyday conversations and daily usage. Focus will be on appropriateness in application.
outcome: Students are expected to: (PO1: for levels 1-2) ask and respond to simple questions, convey minimal meaning and satisfy a very limited number of immediate needs. (S&L1) understand and reply to utterances containing selected vocabulary items and grammar points at the sentence level in daily conversations  學生於完成本科時預期能： （學習成果：第一級和第二級）有限度地使用粵語作簡短問答以應付日常生活中的即時之需。 (S&L1) 掌握基本詞彙，能聽懂日常生活中較簡短的對話
syllabus: This course introduces Cantonese sounds and tones as well as vocabulary items and sentence patterns in relation to the topics below: 1. Greetings 2. At school 3. What time is it? 4. What is today’s date? 5. A shopping day

title: Oral Skills Practice I
description: An elementary course focused on students' fluency in communication with basic vocabulary and grammar points through various kinds of speaking practice. Real life settings are introduced such as shopping, introducing family members, asking directions etc.
outcome: Students are expected to: (PO1: for levels 1-2) ask and respond to simple questions, convey minimal meaning and satisfy a very limited number of immediate needs. (S&L 2) apply selected vocabulary items and grammatical patterns at the sentence level in daily conversations with appropriate usage  學生於完成本科時預期能： （學習成果：第一級和第二級）有限度地使用粵語作簡短問答以應付日常生活中的即時之需。 (S&L2) 將所學句式和詞匯適當地運用於日常生活之中
syllabus: This course provides oral practice with language scenarios in relation to the topics below: 1. Talking about hobbies 2. Telling location 3. Meeting my family 4. Tour around Hong Kong 5. In the office

title: Communication in Context I - Cantonese
description: An elementary course designed to familiarize students with basic vocabulary and grammar points through language tasks/activities and contextualized exercises. Daily Real life settings are introduced.

title: Listening Comprehension and Communication Skills I
description: An elementary course focuses on building up students’ listening ability in real life context. Everyday settings are introduced such as shopping, introducing family members, asking directions etc.

title: Basic Presentation Skills and Daily Situations
description: An elementary course which helps students to build up abilities in presenting basic ideas in real life communication settings. Tasks like picture description, speaking topics and simple presentation will be adopted to train students in presentation with various everyday settings.

title: Elementary Cantonese for Chinese Speakers
requirements: 1. Not for students who have taken CCAN2013 or CCAN2703; 2. For Putonghua speaking non-local students who are absolute beginners in Cantonese.
description: This is a foundation course on Cantonese which introduces the “Yale Romanization Scheme” of Cantonese. Course contents include basic daily conversation, vowels and tone exercises and pronunciation practice. It enables learners to understand the “Yale Romanization Scheme” and engage in real life conversation by using simple Cantonese.
outcome: Students are expected to: (PO2: for levels 3-4) participate in simple conversations on predictable topics, obtain information by asking and answering questions, combine learned materials to communicate personal meanings, satisfy basic personal needs and social demands.  (S&L 4) comprehend and listen to discourses & conversations and give appropriate responses in short connected utterances. 學生於完成本課程時預期能： （學習成果：第一級和第二級）有限度地使用粵語作簡短問答以應付日常生活中的即時之需。  (S&L4) 鞏固所學，提高聆聽理解及做出恰當回應的能力。
syllabus: 粵語語音(聲母、韻母、聲調、廣東話普通話語音比較) 1. 介紹自己 2. 談校園活動 3. 去飯堂食晏 4. 出街買嘢 5. 談娛樂消遣 6. 說香港天氣 7. 介紹我嘅屋企 8. 去睇醫生 9. 介紹香港 10. 論香港民生

title: Reading in Context I
description: An intermediate course to introduce the use of Chinese characters with real life examples and contextualized exercises. It will focus on recognition of Chinese characters and readings at sentence level.

title: Application of Vocabulary and Grammar II
description: An intermediate course designed to familiarize students with the use of more vocabulary and grammar points. Vocabulary introduced based on everyday conversations and daily usage. Focus will be on appropriateness in application.
outcome: Students are expected to: (PO1: for levels 1-2) Able to ask and respond to simple questions, convey minimal meaning and satisfy a very limited number of immediate needs. (S&L1) understand and reply to utterances containing selected vocabulary items and grammar points at the sentence level in daily conversations  學生於完成本科時預期能： （學習成果：第一級和第二級）有限度地使用粵語作簡短問答以應付日常生活中的即時之需。 (S&L1) 掌握基本詞彙，能聽懂日常生活中較簡短的對話
syllabus: This course introduces Cantonese sounds and tones as well as vocabulary items and sentence patterns in relation to the topics below: 1. Ordering food 2. Talking on the Phone 3. Attending birthday party 4. Talking about holiday plans 5. Going to the post office

title: Oral Skills Practice II
description: An intermediate course focused on students' fluency in speaking practice in real life settings, such as going to the airport, attending a wedding party, going to see movies, discussing travel plans, talking about hobbies etc.
outcome: Students are expected to: (PO1: for levels 1-2) Able to ask and respond to simple questions, convey minimal meaning and satisfy a very limited number of immediate needs. (S&L 2) apply selected vocabulary items and grammatical patterns at the sentence level in daily conversations with appropriate usage  學生於完成本科時預期能： （學習成果：第一級和第二級）有限度地使用粵語作簡短問答以應付日常生活中的即時之需。 (S&L2)將所學句式和詞匯適當地運用於日常生活之中
syllabus: This course provides oral practice with language scenarios in relation to the topics below: 1. Shopping in a department store 2. Talking about major festivals in Hong Kong 3. Telling about the weather today 4. Going to see doctor 5. Moving into my new house

title: Communication in Context II - Cantonese
description: An upper elementary course designed to familiarize students with newly acquired vocabulary and grammar points through language tasks/activities and contextualized exercises in real life informal settings.

title: Listening Comprehension and Communication Skills II
description: An intermediate course focused on building up students' listening ability. Real life settings are introduced such as going to the airport, attending a wedding party, going to see movies,discussing travel plans, talking about hobbies etc.

title: Intermediate Cantonese for Chinese Speakers
requirements: 1. For students who have taken CCAN1703(2013).;2. Not for students who have taken CCAN3703 or CCAN3013.;3. For students who have not completed any of the above coures listed in #1, they are invited to take a Cantonese placement test offered by CLC.
description: An intermediate course for students who have completed CCAN1703 or CCAN2013. For students who have not completed any of the above course, they are invited to take a Cantonese placement test offered by CLC. Course contents focus on social topics. Trainings in different contexts can increase students’ vocabulary. It also improves their pronunciation and exchange of ideas in different social activities. Furthermore, it assists them to complete a number of tasks in school or working environments.Advisory: Not for IASP or CHES major students; For Putonghua speaking non-local students who are not beginners.
outcome: Students are expected to: (PO3: for levels 5-6) participate actively in conversations on various topics in some formal and most informal settings, handle a wide variety of speaking tasks with communicative strategies, deal effectively with unanticipated complications in oral communication, which can satisfy the requirements of school and work situations.  (S&L 3) communicate fluently in professional discourses containing selected vocabulary items and grammatical structures in real life settings.  (R3) comprehend and read Chinese readings at paragraph level in real life contexts.  學生於完成本課程時預期能： (學習成果：第五級和第六級）具備參與在正式及非正式場合中談話的能力，能就不同話題發表意見，並根據不同交際場境調整談話策略， 能完成學習或工作中常見的任務。  (S&L 3) 掌握於現實生活中不同語境進行簡單交際所需的詞彙和句式，並能較恰當地運用。  (R3) 讀懂由所學過詞匯及語法組成的句子及短文。
syllabus: 粵語語音、廣東話普通話語音比較 1. 改善居住環境 2. 體驗香港美食 3. 閒話潮流服飾 4. 乘搭交通工具 5. 協助處理罪案 6. 參加文娛活動 7. 了解草根民生 8. 關注環境保護 9. 探討社會問題 10. 暢談教育制度

title: Reading in Context II
description: An upper intermediate course to introduce the use of Chinese characters with real life examples and contextualized exercises. It will focus on recognition of Chinese characters and readings at paragraph level.

title: Application of Vocabulary and Grammar III
description: An upper intermediate course designed to familiarize students with the use of newly acquired vocabulary and grammar points. Focus will be on appropriateness in application. Real life settings are introduced such as buying a computer, going to the doctor, renting a flat, moving to a new home etc.
outcome: Students are expected to: (PO2: for levels 3-4) participate in simple conversations on predictable topics, obtain information by asking and answering questions, combine learned materials to communicate personal meanings, can satisfy basic personal needs and social demands. (S&L 1) understand and reply to short connected utterances containing selected vocabulary items and grammatical structures in most real life conversations  學生於完成本科時預期能： （學習成果：第三級和第四級）於預設話題中參與簡單的會話或討論、能通過提問和回答獲取資料，並結合所學內容與人溝通、能滿足基本的交際需要。 (S&L 1) 掌握基本詞彙，能聽懂日常生活中較簡短的對話。
syllabus: This course introduces Cantonese sounds and tones as well as vocabulary items and sentence patterns in relation to the topics below: 1. Finding a place or a person 2. City transportation 3. Wedding 4. Travelling and airport 5. Courtesy and custom

title: Oral Skills Practice III
requirements: Prerequisite: CCAN2233 and CCAN2243.;Not for students who have taken CCAN4413, 4423, 4433, 4443, 4513, 4523, 4533, 4633, 4643 and 4653.
description: An upper intermediate course focused on students' fluency in speaking practice with newly acquired vocabulary and grammar points. Real life settings are introduced such as buying a computer, going to the doctor, renting a flat, moving to a new home etc.

title: Communication in Context III - Cantonese
description: An intermediate course designed to familiarize students with newly acquired vocabulary and grammar points through language tasks/activities and contextualized exercises. Real life formal and informal settings are introduced.

title: Listening Comprehension and Communication Skills III
description: An upper intermediate course focused on building up students' listening ability. Real life settings are introduced such as buying a computer, going to the doctor, renting a flat, moving to a new home etc.

title: Advanced Cantonese for Chinese Speakers
requirements: 1. For students who have taken CCAN2703 (3013). ;2. For students who have not completed any of the above course, they are invited to take a Cantonese placement test offered by CLC.
description: An advanced course for students who have completed CCAN2703 or CCAN3013. For students who have not completed any of the above course, they are invited to join the Cantonese placement offered by CLC.This course equips students with various advanced communicative skills in various academic and professional settings, such as seminars, meetings, group discussions, debate, presentations, performance, impromptu speaking etc. Students are trained to speak in connected discourse in academic and professional settings with different level of formality.Advisory: Not for IASP or CHES major students; For Putonghua speaking non-local students who are not beginners.
outcome: Students are expected to: (PO3: for levels 5-6) participate actively in conversations on various topics in some formal and most informal settings, handle a wide variety of speaking tasks with communicative strategies, deal effectively with unanticipated complications in oral communication, which can satisfy the requirements of school and work situations.  (S&L 5) present ideas at the discourse level in real life professional settings. (R3) comprehend and read Chinese readings at paragraph level in real life contexts.  學生於完成本科時預期能： (學習成果：第五級和第六級）具備參與在正式及非正式場合中談話的能力，能就不同話題發表意見，並根據不同交際場境調整談話策略， 能完成學習或工作中常見的任務。  (S&L 5) 將所學句式和辭彙運用於適當的專業語境之中。  (R3) 讀懂由所學過詞匯及語法組成的句子及短文。
syllabus: 1. 關注年青一代 2. 計劃多彩假期 3. 漫談本地娛圈 4. 參與體育活動 5. 討論香港政策 6 . 分享投資心得 7. 細說香港樓市 8. 暢談科技世界 9. 招聘理想人才 10. 探討道德價值

title: Reading in Context III
description: An advanced course to introduce the use of Chinese characters with real life examples and contextualized exercises in a wide variety of settings. It will focus on recognition of Chinese characters and readings at discourse level.

title: Communication in Professional Settings
description: An advanced course designed to help students communicate with extended vocabulary in advanced settings through real life language tasks/activities and contextualized exercises. Topics include social issues in Hong Kong, environmental issues, Chinese custom and religion etc.

title: Colloquial Cantonese and Local Culture
description: An advanced course designed to improve students’ fluency in real life communication settings through various language activities and discussion practice. Topics for discussion include social issues in Hong Kong, environmental issues, Chinese custom and religion etc.
outcome: Students are expected to: (PO2: for levels 3-4) participate in simple conversations on predictable topics, obtain information by asking and answering questions, combine learned materials to communicate personal meanings, can satisfy basic personal needs and social demands. (S&L 2) apply selected vocabulary items and grammatical structures in short connected utterances in most real life conversations with appropriate usage  學生於完成本科時預期能： （學習成果：第三級和第四級）於預設話題中參與簡單的會話或討論、能通過提問和回答獲取資料，並結合所學內容與人溝通、能滿足基本的交際需要。 (S&L2) 將所學句式和詞匯適當地運用於日常生活之中
syllabus: This course provides vocabulary and oral practice with language scenarios in relation to informal speaking styles. 1. Cantonese colloquialism 2. Informal conversations

title: Communication in Context IV - Cantonese
description: An upper intermediate course designed to help students communicate with extended vocabulary in formal settings through real life language tasks/activities and contextualized exercises.

title: Special Topics I
description: An advanced course focused on building up students’ listening ability in advanced context and presenting students with multi-media authentic materials. Topics for discussion include social issues in Hong Kong, environmental issues, Chinese custom and religion etc.

title: Advanced Reading and Speaking
description: An advanced course to introduce the use of Chinese characters with authentic materials and contextualized exercises in professional settings. Readings will be based on materials such as prose, argumentative essays, descriptive essays, drama scripts, etc.

title: Discussion Topics on Hong Kong Issues
description: An advanced course designed to build up the students’ confidence in using a variety of vocabulary in formal settings through specific topics and contextualized exercises. Topics include various local news and issues related to our society, such as education system, economy and immigration.

title: Discussion Topics on China Issues
description: An advanced course designed to further improve students’ fluency in professional communication settings through language activities, role playing and discussion practice. Topics for discussion include various China news and issues related to the Chinese society, such as education system, economy and immigration.

title: Communication in Context V - Cantonese
description: An advanced course designed to train students’ presentation and negotiation ability in professional settings. Topics for discussion include various local & international news and issues related to our society, such as education system, economy and immigration.

title: Listening Comprehension Skills in Professional Settings
description: An advanced course focused on building up students' listening ability in professional context and presenting students with multi-media authentic materials. Topics for discussion include various local and international news and issues related to our society, such as education system,economy and immigration.

title: Newspaper Reading
description: An advanced course designed to improve students' language ability through the reading anddiscussion of selections from newspapers in standard written Chinese. Topics include international relations, political news, crime, economic news, accidents, etc.

title: Special Topics II
description: Courses designed for different kinds of working professionals, such asbusinesspersons, bankers, financial consultants, education specialists, religious and social workers, etc. Sector specific trainings are designed to cater for advanced students’ needs. e.g. the Cantonese for religious workers course provides training on Bible reading, Sunday liturgy and Mass liturgy.
